help.title: Help Center
help.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Jadwali
help.no_results: No results found for your search.
help.getting_started_desc: New to Jadwali? Start your setup here.
help.section_getting_started_overview: Follow these steps to set up your school: configure school days, add periods, create subjects, register teachers, set up classes and rooms, then generate your first timetable.
help.section_getting_started_q1: How do I set up my school for the first time?
help.section_getting_started_a1: Go to Settings and start by setting your school name, country, and timezone. Then configure your school days (which days of the week you have classes) and add your daily periods with their time slots.
help.section_getting_started_q2: What is the recommended setup order?
help.section_getting_started_a2: We recommend: 1) School info & days (Settings), 2) Periods (Settings), 3) Subjects (Resources), 4) Teachers, 5) Classes (Resources), 6) Rooms (Resources), 7) Generate timetable. This order ensures each step has the data it depends on.
help.section_getting_started_q3: Can I import existing data instead of entering it manually?
help.section_getting_started_a3: Yes! Jadwali supports CSV import for teachers, subjects, classes, and rooms. Go to Settings > Data section, or use the Import button on each page. You can download a template CSV to see the expected format.
help.section_getting_started_q4: How do I invite other users (teachers, students)?
help.section_getting_started_a4: Go to Team Management (Users page). Add users with their email and role. Teachers can sign up with your school code and will be linked to their teacher record. Students sign up with the school code and select their class.
help.section_dashboard_overview: The dashboard gives you a real-time overview of your school: today's lessons, absent teachers, quick stats, conflict alerts, and quick action shortcuts.
help.section_dashboard_q1: What do the dashboard statistics show?
help.section_dashboard_a1: The top cards show: total Classes, Teachers (with how many are absent today), Rooms (available now), and Coverage rate (percentage of lessons covered this term). These update in real-time as you make changes.
help.section_dashboard_q2: What is the Today's Overview section?
help.section_dashboard_a2: It shows all lessons scheduled for the current day, grouped by period. Each card displays the subject, teacher, class, and room. Red badges indicate conflicts or absent teachers that need attention.
help.section_dashboard_q3: How do I quickly generate a timetable from the dashboard?
help.section_dashboard_a3: Use the AI Schedule Generator panel on the dashboard. Click 'Generate Schedule' to create a complete, conflict-free timetable based on your configured subjects, teachers, and constraints.
help.section_dashboard_q4: What do teachers and students see on their dashboard?
help.section_dashboard_a4: Teachers see their personal lessons for today and their absence history. Students see their class timetable for today. Both have quick actions relevant to their role.
help.section_timetable_overview: The timetable page displays your school schedule in a weekly grid. Switch between class, teacher, or room views. Admins can drag-and-drop lessons, manually add/edit lessons, and generate AI-powered schedules.
help.section_timetable_q1: How do I switch between class, teacher, and room views?
help.section_timetable_a1: Use the view switcher tabs at the top of the timetable (Class / Teacher / Room). Then use the filter pills below to select a specific class, teacher, or room. The grid will show only lessons matching your selection.
help.section_timetable_a2: On desktop, simply click and drag any lesson card to a different time slot. The system will automatically check for conflicts (teacher double-booking, room overlap, class conflicts) and warn you if the move causes issues.
help.section_timetable_q3: How do I generate a timetable with AI?
help.section_timetable_a3: Go to the AI Assistant page and click 'Generate full timetable', or use the dashboard's AI panel. The solver considers all your constraints: teacher availability, room capacity, subject requirements per grade, and maximum periods per day/week.
help.section_timetable_q4: What do Published and Draft statuses mean?
help.section_timetable_a4: Draft means the timetable is still being worked on — only admins can see it. Published means it's visible to all teachers and students. Use the Publish button to toggle between states.
help.section_timetable_q5: Can I export or import a timetable?
help.section_timetable_a5: Yes. Use the Export button to download the timetable as CSV. For import, prepare a CSV with columns: Day, Period, Class, Subject, Teacher, Room — the system will match names against your existing data.
help.section_teachers_overview: Manage your teaching staff: add/edit teacher profiles, assign subjects, set workload limits, and track availability.
help.section_teachers_q1: How do I add a new teacher?
help.section_teachers_a1: Click 'Add Teacher' on the Teachers page. Fill in their name, email, phone, select the subjects they teach (first selected = primary subject), set max periods per day/week, and choose a color for visual identification.
help.section_teachers_a2: When checked, this teacher will never be suggested as a substitute when another teacher is absent. Use this for part-time staff, department heads, or anyone who shouldn't take on additional cover duties.
help.section_teachers_q3: What are Max Periods per Day and per Week?
help.section_teachers_a3: These limits control how many teaching slots a teacher can have. The AI scheduler respects these when generating timetables. 'Near Maximum' warnings appear on teacher cards when they're close to their limits.
help.section_teachers_q4: Can I bulk-import teachers from a spreadsheet?
help.section_teachers_a4: Yes. Click the Import button and upload a CSV file with columns: Name, Email, Phone, Subjects (semicolon-separated), Max/Day, Max/Week. Download the template first to see the exact format.
help.section_absences_overview: Report teacher absences, view affected periods, and find qualified substitutes using the AI matching system.
help.section_absences_q1: How do I report a teacher absence?
help.section_absences_a1: Click 'Report Absence' on the Absences page. Select the teacher, date, absence type (sick, personal, training, etc.), and whether it's full-day or half-day. The system automatically identifies which periods are affected.
help.section_absences_q2: How does the AI substitute matching work?
help.section_absences_a2: Click 'Find Substitute' on any uncovered absence. The AI evaluates all available teachers based on: subject qualification, current workload, availability for that period, and whether they teach the same grade. Results are ranked by match score.
help.section_absences_q3: What do Covered and Uncovered statuses mean?
help.section_absences_a3: Covered means a substitute has been assigned for all affected periods. Uncovered means some or all periods still need a replacement teacher. The dashboard highlights uncovered absences for immediate attention.
help.section_absences_a4: Yes. Enable 'Auto-assign Substitutes' in Settings > Substitute Settings. The system will automatically pick the highest-scoring available teacher without requiring admin approval.
help.section_leave_overview: Teachers can request leave, admins can approve/reject, and the system tracks balances against configured leave types.
help.section_leave_a1: Teachers go to the Leave page and click 'Request Leave'. They select the leave type, start and end dates, and provide a reason. The request goes to admin for approval (unless the leave type is set to auto-approve).
help.section_leave_q2: How do I configure leave types?
help.section_leave_a2: Go to Settings > Leave Types. You can add types like Sick Leave, Personal, Training, etc. For each type, set the maximum days per year, a color, and whether it requires admin approval.
help.section_leave_q3: How is the days balance calculated?
help.section_leave_a3: The system counts all approved leave days per type for the current year. The balance shown on the Leave page is total approved days against the maximum configured for that leave type.
help.section_calendar_overview: Manage school events, holidays, exam periods, and other date-based activities that affect the schedule.
help.section_calendar_q1: How do I add a school event?
help.section_calendar_a1: Click 'Add Event' on the Calendar page. Enter the event name, type (holiday, exam, trip, meeting, etc.), start and end dates, and which classes are affected. Events appear on the calendar for all relevant users.
help.section_calendar_a2: Available types: Exams, Holiday, School Trip, Staff Meeting, Sports Day, Parent Day, School Closure, and Other. Each type has a distinct color on the calendar for easy visual identification.
help.section_calendar_a3: Holidays and school closures are displayed on the calendar as reference dates. The timetable generator does not currently skip holiday dates, so plan your academic terms accordingly.
help.section_resources_overview: Master data management for your school's subjects, classes, and rooms. These form the building blocks of your timetable.
help.section_resources_a1: Go to Resources > Subjects tab. Click 'Add Subject'. Enter the name (with optional French and Arabic translations), select a category (Core, Elective, Science, etc.), and pick a color. Subjects are used when adding teachers and generating timetables.
help.section_resources_q2: How do I set up classes?
help.section_resources_a2: Go to Resources > Classes tab. Click 'Add Class'. Enter the name, select the grade (if grades are configured in Settings), set capacity, and choose a color. Classes are the student groups assigned to timetable slots.
help.section_resources_a3: Room types include: Classroom, Lab, Science Lab, Computer Lab, Gym, Auditorium, Art Studio, Library, and Other. Room types help the AI scheduler match subjects to appropriate facilities.
help.section_resources_q4: Can I import subjects, classes, and rooms from CSV?
help.section_resources_a4: Yes. Each tab has an Import button. Download the template to see the required columns, fill in your data, and upload. The system validates each row and shows a preview before committing.
help.section_reports_overview: View analytics on faculty workload, class schedules, leave patterns, and substitute usage.
help.section_reports_a1: Four report tabs: Faculty (teacher workload and period counts), Classes (class schedules and student counts), Leave (request history and day totals), and Substitutes (cover assignments and frequency).
help.section_reports_a2: Report data is viewable in-app as tables. To export, use the Export feature from the relevant page (e.g., export teachers from the Teachers page for workload data).
help.section_reports_a3: Workload is based on the number of assigned timetable periods vs. the teacher's max periods per week. The Faculty report shows total periods, daily max, weekly max, and absence count for each teacher.
help.section_ai_overview: Chat with the AI assistant to generate timetables, find conflicts, optimize workloads, and get scheduling suggestions.
help.section_ai_q1: What can the AI assistant do?
help.section_ai_a1: The AI can: generate a full conflict-free timetable, find and list all scheduling conflicts, suggest workload optimizations, find substitute teachers for absences, and answer questions about your schedule data.
help.section_ai_q2: How does the AI timetable generation work?
help.section_ai_a2: The solver takes your configured subjects, teachers (with their subject qualifications and max periods), classes (with grade curriculum), rooms, and periods. It produces an optimized schedule that avoids conflicts and respects all constraints.
help.section_ai_q3: What if the generated timetable has issues?
help.section_ai_a3: You can manually adjust any lesson via drag-and-drop or the edit modal. If there are many issues, try adjusting your constraints (increase max periods, add more teachers, or reduce subject hours) and regenerate.
help.section_ai_q4: Is the AI available on all plans?
help.section_ai_a4: AI chat is available on Pro and Enterprise plans. The timetable generator is available on all plans, including Free (with limited class count).
help.section_settings_overview: Configure school information, academic setup (periods, grades), notifications, leave types, substitute rules, security, and data management.
help.section_settings_q1: How do I configure school days and periods?
help.section_settings_a1: Go to Settings > Academic Setup. Select which days your school operates (Mon-Sat). Then add periods with name, start time, and end time. Mark breaks/recess as break periods. Use 'Active Days' to make specific periods apply only on certain days.
help.section_settings_q2: What is the 'Active Days' feature on periods?
help.section_settings_a2: Active Days lets you assign a period to specific school days only. For example, if Period 7 only happens on Monday and Wednesday, select only those days. Leave all selected for periods that occur every school day.
help.section_settings_q3: How do grades and curriculum work?
help.section_settings_a3: Go to Settings > Grades & Curriculum. Create grade levels (e.g., '7th Grade'), then assign subjects with weekly hours (e.g., Math 4h/week). Also assign which teachers can teach each grade. The AI scheduler uses this to build timetables.
help.section_settings_q4: How do I manage data exports and imports?
help.section_settings_a4: Go to Settings > Data section. Export any entity type (teachers, subjects, classes, rooms) as CSV. Import from CSV with automatic validation and preview before committing changes.
help.section_settings_a5: Three toggles: Absence alerts (when a teacher reports absent), Conflict alerts (when scheduling conflicts are detected), and Substitute assignments (when a substitute is assigned). These control in-app notifications.
help.section_settings_q6: Where do I find my school code to share with teachers and students?
help.section_settings_a6: Go to Settings > School Information. Your school code is displayed right below the school name. Click the Copy button to copy it to your clipboard, then share it with teachers and students so they can enter it during signup to join your school.
help.section_billing_overview: Manage your subscription, view plan features, process payments through Konnect or Paymee, and view invoice history.
help.section_billing_a1: Four plans: Free (limited classes and features), Starter (more classes, export), Pro (unlimited classes, AI chat, priority support), and Enterprise (custom pricing, dedicated support). See the billing page for detailed feature lists.
help.section_billing_q2: How do I upgrade my plan?
help.section_billing_a2: Go to Billing & Plan, select a plan, and click Upgrade. Choose Konnect or Paymee as your payment provider, enter your details, and complete the payment. Your plan activates immediately upon successful payment.
help.section_billing_q3: How does billing work? Is it auto-recurring?
help.section_billing_a3: Billing is manual renewal — there are no auto-recurring charges. When your subscription expires, you'll be prompted to renew. Your plan features remain active until the expiration date.
help.section_billing_q4: What happens when my subscription expires?
help.section_billing_a4: Your school automatically downgrades to the Free plan. Your data is preserved, but premium features (AI chat, extra classes, etc.) become unavailable until you renew.

onboarding.welcome_desc: Let's set up your school in a few easy steps. You'll configure your schedule structure, add your staff and resources, and generate your first timetable.
onboarding.school_days_desc: Select which days of the week your school operates. This determines the columns in your timetable grid.
onboarding.periods_desc: Add your daily time slots: teaching periods, breaks, and lunch. Each period has a start time, end time, and name.
onboarding.subjects_desc: Create the subjects taught at your school (e.g., Math, Science, Arabic). Each subject gets a category and color for visual identification.
onboarding.teachers_desc: Add your teaching staff with their subject qualifications, contact info, and workload limits (max periods per day/week).
onboarding.classes_desc: Set up your student groups (e.g., 7A, 8B). Assign each class to a grade level and set its capacity.
onboarding.rooms_desc: Register your school's rooms with type (classroom, lab, gym), building, and capacity. Rooms are assigned to lessons in the timetable.
onboarding.timetable_desc: With all data in place, use the AI generator to create a complete, conflict-free timetable — or build it manually with drag-and-drop.
onboarding.review_desc: Your school is configured. Explore the dashboard, fine-tune your timetable, invite teachers, and manage your schedule with ease.

tooltips.per_day_periods: Active Days lets you restrict this period to specific school days. Useful for half-day schedules or periods that only occur on certain days.
tooltips.ai_generate: The AI solver creates a conflict-free timetable respecting all constraints: teacher qualifications, workload limits, room capacity, and grade curriculum.
tooltips.exclude_cover: When enabled, this teacher will never appear in substitute suggestions. Use for staff who shouldn't take cover duties (part-time, admin roles).
tooltips.grade_curriculum: Define which subjects each grade studies and how many hours per week. The AI scheduler uses this to distribute lessons across the timetable.
tooltips.conflict_detection: Jadwali checks for 3 types of conflicts: teacher double-booking, room overlap, and class scheduling conflicts. Red badges indicate issues.
tooltips.auto_assign_subs: When enabled, the system automatically assigns the best-matching available teacher as substitute without requiring admin approval.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.section_intro_content: jadwali.ai ("we", "us", "our") is a smart school scheduling platform operated from Tunisia. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal data when you use our service. We are committed to complying with Tunisian Organic Law No. 2004-63 on the protection of personal data, as well as international best practices for data privacy.
privacy.section_data_collected_content: We collect the following categories of personal data to provide our scheduling service:
privacy.section_data_collected_account_desc: School name, administrator name, email address, and hashed password. A unique school code is generated for user onboarding.
privacy.section_data_collected_teacher_desc: Full names, email addresses, phone numbers, subject qualifications, weekly workload limits, and scheduling preferences.
privacy.section_data_collected_student_desc: Student names and class assignments, as provided by school administrators.
privacy.section_data_collected_schedule_desc: Timetables, lesson assignments, absence records, substitution history, leave requests, and calendar events.
privacy.section_data_collected_usage_desc: Pages visited, features used, and session duration to help us improve the platform.
privacy.section_data_collected_technical_desc: Browser type, IP address, device information, and locale preference.
privacy.section_how_used_content: We use your personal data for the following purposes:
privacy.section_how_used_item1: Provide and maintain the scheduling service, including timetable generation and conflict detection
privacy.section_how_used_item2: Generate AI-powered timetables and substitute teacher recommendations
privacy.section_how_used_item3: Process subscription payments through Konnect and Paymee
privacy.section_how_used_item4: Send service notifications such as absence alerts and conflict warnings
privacy.section_how_used_item5: Improve the platform, fix bugs, and enhance features based on usage patterns
privacy.section_how_used_item6: Comply with legal obligations under Tunisian law
privacy.section_storage_content: We take data security seriously. All passwords are hashed using industry-standard algorithms. Communication is encrypted via HTTPS with strict transport security. We implement security headers including X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, and Content-Security-Policy. Your scheduling data is stored in secure databases with access limited to authorized personnel only. We conduct regular security reviews and will implement encryption at rest as the platform scales to cloud infrastructure.
privacy.section_third_party_content: We work with the following trusted third-party providers:
privacy.section_third_party_konnect: Konnect (Payment Gateway): Receives your name and payment amount to process transactions via bank cards, e-DINAR, and digital wallets. Subject to Konnect's own privacy policy.
privacy.section_third_party_paymee: Paymee (Payment Gateway): Receives your name, email, and payment amount for bank card transactions. Subject to Paymee's own privacy policy.
privacy.section_third_party_ai: AI Providers: Anonymized scheduling data (periods, subject hours, constraints) may be sent to AI services for timetable generation. No personally identifiable teacher or student data is transmitted to AI providers.
privacy.section_third_party_no_sell: We do not sell, rent, or trade your personal data to any third party. We do not use advertising trackers.
privacy.section_cookies_content: jadwali.ai does not use third-party tracking cookies. We use browser localStorage to store your authentication session and locale preference. Our PWA service worker caches application assets for offline performance. No analytics or advertising cookies are deployed.
privacy.section_rights_intro: Under Tunisian Organic Law No. 2004-63 on the protection of personal data, you have the following rights:
privacy.section_rights_access: Right to access your personal data held by us
privacy.section_rights_rectify: Right to rectify any inaccurate or incomplete data
privacy.section_rights_delete: Right to request deletion of your personal data
privacy.section_rights_object: Right to object to the processing of your data
privacy.section_rights_portability: Right to data portability — export your data as CSV at any time via Settings
privacy.section_rights_exercise: To exercise any of these rights, contact us at privacy@jadwali.ai. We will respond within 30 days.
privacy.section_retention_content: Account and scheduling data is retained while your account is active. Upon account deletion, personal data is purged within 30 days. Payment records are retained for 5 years as required by Tunisian financial regulations. Backup data is purged within 90 days of account deletion.
privacy.section_children_content: Student data is collected and managed by school administrators on behalf of their institutions. jadwali.ai does not directly collect data from minors. Schools are responsible for obtaining any required parental consent for the processing of student data in accordance with applicable laws.
privacy.section_changes_content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. Material changes will be communicated through an in-app notification. Your continued use of jadwali.ai after changes are posted constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.
privacy.section_contact_content: For any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us:

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.section_acceptance_content: By accessing or using jadwali.ai, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree, you must not use the service. These terms apply to all users: school owners, administrators, teachers, and students. If you are accepting these terms on behalf of a school or organization, you represent that you have the authority to bind that entity.
terms.section_service_content: jadwali.ai is an AI-powered school scheduling platform that provides timetable generation, absence management, substitute teacher matching, leave management, calendar events, and analytics reporting. The service is available as a web application and progressive web app (PWA). We strive to provide reliable service but it is offered on an "as-is" basis without guarantees of uninterrupted availability.
terms.section_accounts_content: To use jadwali.ai, a school administrator must create an account with a school name and email address. Additional users (teachers, students) can join via the school's unique code. User roles include Owner, Admin, Teacher, and Student, each with different access levels. You are responsible for maintaining the security of your account credentials and for all activity that occurs under your account.
terms.section_plans_content: jadwali.ai offers the following subscription plans, priced in Tunisian Dinars (DT):
terms.section_plans_free: Free — 0 DT/month: Up to 10 teachers, 5 classes, 1 timetable. Basic features with community support.
terms.section_plans_starter: Starter — 89 DT/month (or 854 DT/year): Up to 30 teachers, 15 classes, 3 timetables. AI generation, CSV export, email support.
terms.section_plans_pro: Pro — 249 DT/month (or 2,390 DT/year): Up to 80 teachers, 40 classes, unlimited timetables. Priority support, advanced analytics.
terms.section_plans_enterprise: Enterprise — Custom pricing: Unlimited resources, dedicated support, custom integrations. Contact us for details.
terms.section_plans_note: Annual billing includes a 20% discount. Plan features and limits are subject to change with 30 days notice.
terms.section_payments_content: Payments are processed through Konnect and Paymee, both trusted Tunisian payment providers. jadwali.ai uses a manual renewal model — there are no automatic recurring charges. When your subscription period ends, your plan downgrades to Free unless you manually renew. Payments are non-refundable once processed. We do not store your credit card information; all payment data is handled securely by our payment providers.
terms.section_acceptable_use_content: You agree to use jadwali.ai only for legitimate school scheduling purposes. You must not: reverse engineer, decompile, or disassemble the software; use automated tools to scrape or extract data; upload malicious content or attempt to compromise system security; share account credentials across different schools or organizations; use the service in any way that violates Tunisian law or international regulations. We reserve the right to suspend or terminate accounts that violate these terms.
terms.section_ip_content: You retain full ownership of your school data, including schedules, teacher information, and student records. jadwali.ai owns the platform, design, source code, AI algorithms, and all related intellectual property. By using the service, you grant us a limited license to process your data solely to provide the scheduling service. You may export your data at any time via CSV export in Settings, ensuring complete data portability.
terms.section_ai_content: Timetables and schedules generated by our AI engine are recommendations, not guarantees. While our algorithm optimizes for conflict-free scheduling, certain complex constraints may result in imperfect solutions. School administrators should review all AI-generated schedules before implementation. Substitute teacher recommendations are suggestions based on availability and qualifications; final staffing decisions rest with school administrators. We do not guarantee conflict-free schedules in all scenarios.
terms.section_liability_content: jadwali.ai is not liable for scheduling errors, missed classes, operational disruptions, or any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from the use of the service. Our maximum aggregate liability is limited to the total fees you have paid to us in the 12 months preceding the claim. The service is provided without warranty of fitness for a particular purpose. We are not responsible for issues caused by third-party payment gateways or AI providers.
terms.section_availability_content: We aim for high availability but do not guarantee a specific uptime percentage. Scheduled maintenance windows will be communicated in advance when possible. We may modify, update, or discontinue features with 30 days prior notice. In the event of service discontinuation, users will be given a minimum of 90 days to export their data.
terms.section_termination_content: You may delete your account at any time from your account settings or by contacting support. We may terminate or suspend accounts that violate these Terms of Service. Upon termination, you will have 30 days to export your data, after which it will be permanently deleted. Subscription fees are not prorated upon early termination.

support.title: Support
support.subtitle: Get in touch with our team or find answers in our knowledge base
support.contact_desc: Our support team is here to help with any questions about jadwali.ai.
support.faq_q1: How do I reset my password?
support.faq_a1: Go to the login page and click "Forgot password?" to receive a password reset email. If you're already logged in, you can change your password in Settings > Account.
support.faq_q2: How do I upgrade my subscription plan?
support.faq_a2: Navigate to Billing & Plan from the sidebar. Choose your desired plan and billing cycle, then complete payment through Konnect or Paymee.
support.faq_q3: How do I export my school data?
support.faq_a3: Go to Settings > Data section and click Export. You can export teachers, subjects, classes, and rooms as CSV files. Timetables can be exported from the Timetable page.
support.faq_q4: What payment methods do you accept?
support.faq_a4: We accept payments through Konnect (bank cards, e-DINAR, digital wallets) and Paymee (bank cards). All prices are in Tunisian Dinars (DT).
support.faq_a5: Payments are non-refundable once processed. Since we use a manual renewal model with no auto-recurring charges, you have full control over when you pay.
support.faq_q6: How do I delete my account?
support.faq_a6: Contact us at support@jadwali.ai with your account email. We will process account deletion within 30 days, after which all data is permanently removed.
support.faq_a7: Yes. We use HTTPS encryption, security headers (CSP, X-Frame-Options, HSTS), hashed passwords, and strict access controls. We comply with Tunisian data protection law (Organic Law No. 2004-63).
support.faq_a8: Email us at support@jadwali.ai. Response times depend on your subscription plan, ranging from 4 hours (Enterprise) to 48 hours (Free).
